text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with spinach toast would his
spinach toast it's what happens when you
have some leftover creamed spinach that
you don't want to throw away but you're
tired of eating as a side dish so I took
a couple slices of bread nice and thick
if you're gonna do something like this
got to be at least a half inch to an
inch thick I toasted them in just a
regular toaster I painted the lighter of
the two sides with olive oil there's
always a light in the dark side when you
toast at least I might toaster so I
painted the light side with olive oil I
flipped it over on a foil lined baking
sheet and I'm gonna do four of these cuz
that's how much leftovers I have then I
took my creamed spinach and I spread it
over the toast now really important here
because we're gonna broil these at the
end make sure you go all the way to the
edge otherwise you're gonna have burnt
toast so I spread that on and this did
not have any cheese in it as you
remember from the creamed spinach demo
so I'm gonna top this with parmesan I'm
gonna bake that at 425 for ten minutes
then I popped it under the broiler for
just a couple minutes to brown the top
it was unbelievable and as you well know
a cook a chef is only as good as their
leftovers so anyway if you made the
creamed spinach or you're gonna make the
creamed spinach remember this it is a
great way to finish that off made a
really super nice easy quick lunch
anyway I hope you give that a try
enjoy
you
